content.description:
Stairs are on as well as the structural support beams; however, the rails are not on until you get to the third floor and are ready to top out.

Get a good sit start on the third step, and then follow the roofy jug haul all the way up to the third floor. Then utilize those tasty heel hooks, and find a way to top out.
content.location: Enter Tomichi via the southwest entrance, and you will see the staircase.

content.description: This is a challenging campus climb!!! Custy holds make it very challenging. A fall could be fatal. The anchors are bomber and safe.
content.protection: Slings or maybe a static rope.
content.location: It ascends the Tomichi staircase at Western State.

content.description:
Starting under the first flight of stairs at the bottom floor of Rubidoux, climb under the staircases all the way up. The sides of the stairs are on, along with the stairs themselves, the bars are not until you get to the anchors, including feet.

Be prepared for slippery jug holds for the staircases (bring chalk if you're lame).
content.protection: These are all on the third floor, back stairwell at Rubidoux. The main anchor point, is the beam that is closest to the door near the stairwell, use common sense and only actually weight this part of your anchor. It's best to belay from above. A number 5 cam actually fits bomber in between the vent and the brick wall, still don't weight it, haha. Also a number 1 nut/stopper is necessary for the anchor, because it's hilarious. DO NOT WEIGHT THIS PLACEMENT. Overall, if you equalize your anchor to just mainly using that beam, you're golden. P.S. a spotter is helpful to watch out for RAs.
content.location: Go to the back door of Rubidoux, the one facing the fieldhouse. Head left once you get in the door, and take the door on the left that leads to the stairs. The anchor is on the 3rd floor (4th including the basement floor), and the climber begins climbing on the lowest level of Rub.

content.description: This is an indoor boulder route that features various types of rock embedded in concrete. Dusty holds covered in spider webs make this an ideal winter route for when you're bored out of your mind.
content.protection: A spotter, both for the climber and for stray RDs, RAs, and various janitorial staff.
content.location: It is located in the hallway connecting Dolores Hall with Colorado Hall.

content.description: Go to the Northeast corner of Chipeta Hall. Step up onto the sloping red bricks about 4 feet up laybacking off the corner. The crux is turning to the other side. My personal favorite of all the buildering problems in Gunnison. My dad showed me this one. It always seems to give whoever tries it a good laugh. Have fun!
content.location: Chipeta Hall is located on the Southwest part of campus.
